snippet: The authorities said that the motive of the gunman, an Army specialist who was being treated for behavioral and mental health issues, remained unclear, but that the shooting did not appear to be related to terrorism.
abstract: Soldier being evaluated for post-traumatic stress disorder opens fire at Fort Hood military base in Texas, killing three people and wounding 16 before killing himself; shooting sets off huge police response and shuts down sprawling Army base, same facility where a deadly 2009 rampage by an officer resulted in 13 deaths; Pentagon identifies Army Specialist Ivan Lopez as suspected gunman, and says his motive remains unclear.

byline.original: By DAVE MONTGOMERY, MANNY FERNANDEZ and ASHLEY SOUTHALL
byline.contributor: Dave Montgomery reported from Killeen, Tex., Manny Fernandez from Houston and Ashley Southall from New York. Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The authorities said that the motive of the gunman, an Army specialist who was being treated for behavioral and mental health issues, remained unclear, but that the shooting did not appear to be related to terrorism.

headline.main: Iraq Veteran at Fort Hood Kills 3 and Himself in Rampage
headline.print_headline: Iraq Veteran at Fort Hood Kills 3 and Himself
